value:
Before research
Think ahead !
Thinking about data management requirements before new data are even generated may be considered premature. But time spent at this stage can save lots of time later in the research process: it’s easier to think about data organization and documentation beforehand than to reconstruct details that you may no longer readily remember, let alone not at all.
 
This section covers aspects that should be considered from the very start, while some of them matter throughout the research process.

 


Data management plans



Plan ahead, Aspects to be covered, available tools, example DMPs
 

 


Legal and Ethical



How to deal with personal research data
 

 


File handling



What to include in a file name?
File organization/folder structure
File versioning
 

 


File formats



Sustainable and (as much as possible) open – keep data readable long-term
